poem:
Title: Requiem for a Lens

Upon the page, a story breaks,
Cantet, of light and shadow's play.
Through silent reels, a coruscation,
Captured class and education.
Life, now stilled at sixty-three,
Leaves only art's enduring spree.
He touched the Class, brought Cannes to cheer,
Now stands alone, the final seer.
In subtleness, his lens thus prays,
Upon this bright, divided day.
